Earth’s sister planet Venus is experiencing extreme space weather this week after a giant sunspot, invisible from Earth, hurls copious amounts of plasma at the scorching planet.

articles.author: Keith Cooper
articles.title: Space station experiment suggests Mars rovers will need to dig deep to find life - Space.com
articles.description: The search for signs of life, past or present, on Mars may have hit a stumbling blocks as new results show how the rovers will be unable to detect biomarkers on the surface.
articles.content: NASA's Mars rovers shouldn't expect to detect biomarkers on the surface of the Red Planet, according to a new study based on an experiment on board the International Space Station (ISS) that suggests… [+5274 chars]
